title: When the enemy team starts fighting with each other
body:
http://i.imgur.com/9G6ydQl.gif

I'm over here just like

http://i.imgur.com/GHbDgyE.gif

replies.body: This is why I try to break it up.  Sadly it doesn't always work.
Yea, that last picture is usually after I've already tried too.
Usually I just throw the surrender option out.  I'd rather just not play with the team who doesn't want to work together.

I refuse to surrender in about 95% of situations. I just tell my team to stop talking all together and I'll make the calls. I have a pretty decent rate of turning games around if I can just get my team to stop talking. I've found if you tell them to stop enough they eventually get tired of it and do stop.
Wait, you're implying it EVER works?
I've had it work quite a few times. I don't agree with either side. I just tell them to stop talking in general and that we can pull this off if they quit arguing.
I love how spike keeps missing tom lmao...
Level 14 Tanks with tier 1 boots and lag man...

If the enemy team starts raging against each other, I usually point out (very politely) a mistake one of them made that got them killed by my teammates. Then they rage even harder. 

Their salty tears are so delicious. >:D
Does that happen? I turned /allchat off and enjoy the far more now.

It does. I'm pretty good at ignoring the chat when I want to. I like to play champs in character when I play. My two favorite champs right now are {{champion:33}} and{{champion:37}} . Drives all my friends insane when I only say OK or don't speak the entire game.
now this is what i call GG EZ

{{champion:75}} {{champion:29}} and {{champion:107}}?

I bet its support {{champion:223}} and mid {{champion:115}}...
I wonder if anyone gets the reference.
